etymology.description: 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow (bird)") + 麦(麥) (mài, "oat") — swallow oat
etymology.interpretation: 燕麦 refers to oats, which are known for their delicate nature, while '燕' can also represent beauty and grace, much like the bird itself. This combination reflects both the physical attributes and the cultural sentiments associated with these elements.

parts.english: swallow (bird); swallow (to swall; joyful; to sing)

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃燕麦(我喜歡吃燕麥)。
燕麦粥非常好吃(燕麥粥非常好吃)。
